markdown:
Lampad queens are capricious monarchs and protectors of vast underground domains, regarded in ballads and tales as allies and foes, monsters and muses. Lampad queens have a particular animosity for the many predominantly evil underground ancestries, such as [drow](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=37) and [duergar](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=38), and they are particularly fond of bats. Many lampad queens have nykteras (page 254) as favored attendants. **[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Lampad Queen](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1251) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 189 **Perception** +27; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10), [Terran](/Languages.aspx?ID=22), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11); [_stone tell_](/Spells.aspx?ID=310) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +27, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +28, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +31, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +33, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +33, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +27, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +27, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +29, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +25, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +27 **Str** +3 **Dex** +8 **Con** +7 **Int** +4 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +8 **Cavern Empathy** The lampad queen can use [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on and make very simple [Requests](/Actions.aspx?ID=51) of subterranean animals, plants, and fungi, as well as stones.
**Tied to the Land** A lampad queen is intrinsically tied to a specific underground region, usually a cave system. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the lampad queen to automatically attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) spells and rituals that would harm the environment, such as [blight](/Rituals.aspx?ID=4), with a +30 counteract modifier and a counteract level of 8. When the lampad queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, their warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the lampad queen swiftly heals the entire region. --- **AC** 39 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +29 **Will** +25 **HP** 234 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10 **Nymph's Beauty** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) 30 feet. Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 33 Will save or be [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) by the lampad queen's unearthly beauty for 1 minute. While confused by this effect, the creature's confused actions never include harming the lampad queen. --- **Speed** 30 feet, climb 30 feet (on stone only) **Melee** earthen fist +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 3d10+9 bludgeoning plus 1d6 mental **Ranged** light wisp +29 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 2d8+9 mental plus 2d6 fire and 2d6 positive **Primal Prepared Spells** DC 38 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Electric Arc](/Spells.aspx?ID=97), [Guidance](/Spells.aspx?ID=142), [Prestidigitation](/Spells.aspx?ID=229), [Stabilize](/Spells.aspx?ID=307) - **1st** [Ant Haul](/Spells.aspx?ID=13), [Fleet Step](/Spells.aspx?ID=122), [Gust of Wind](/Spells.aspx?ID=143) - **2nd** [Animal Messenger](/Spells.aspx?ID=11), [Enlarge](/Spells.aspx?ID=102), [Faerie Fire](/Spells.aspx?ID=107) - **3rd** [Earthbind](/Spells.aspx?ID=94) (×2), [Haste](/Spells.aspx?ID=147) - **4th** [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125), [Freedom of Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=128), [Resist Energy](/Spells.aspx?ID=256) - **5th** [Death Ward](/Spells.aspx?ID=64), [Passwall](/Spells.aspx?ID=216), [Wall of Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=365) - **6th** [Flesh to Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=123), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289), [Stoneskin](/Spells.aspx?ID=312) - **7th** [Energy Aegis](/Spells.aspx?ID=100), [Regenerate](/Spells.aspx?ID=248), [Volcanic Eruption](/Spells.aspx?ID=360) - **8th** [Earthquake](/Spells.aspx?ID=95), [Summon Plant or Fungus](/Spells.aspx?ID=325) **Primal Innate Spells** DC 38 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Dancing Lights](/Spells.aspx?ID=58) - **2nd** [Faerie Fire](/Spells.aspx?ID=107) - **3rd** [Meld into Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=188) (at will) - **4th** [Shape Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=276) - **7th** [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) - **8th** [Pummeling Rubble](/Spells.aspx?ID=708) - **Constant (6th)** [Stone Tell](/Spells.aspx?ID=310) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** ([Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) Lampad queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91) form, typically choosing a version of their natural form that more closely resembles a humanoid. **Focus Beauty** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) The lampad queen focuses their beauty upon a target within their aura. The creature must attempt a Will save. On a failure, it is affected as if by the queen's beauty aura; if it was already affected by the aura, the conflicting emotions from the lampad queen's beauty intensify, causing the target to no longer get a flat check to end the [_confusion_](/Spells.aspx?ID=48) when it takes damage. The lampad queen can use a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait, to focus the emotions of a confused creature toward a particular emotion, causing it to spend its next turn sobbing uncontrollably, fawning over the lampad queen, or otherwise performing no actions beyond experiencing its emotions. Regardless of the save, the target is temporarily immune to Focus Beauty until the start of the lampad queen's next turn. **Inspiration** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) for [maestro muse](/Muses.aspx?ID=2), the status bonus to Performance checks increases to +2 for the purpose of determining the effects of [compositions](/Traits.aspx?ID=31); for [polymath muse](/Muses.aspx?ID=3), the bard gains a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks; and for all other muses, the Will save bonus increases to +2 against [fey](/Traits.aspx?ID=69). **Despairing Weep** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The lampad queen begins a heart-wrenching fit of weeping, inspiring sympathetic sobbing in nearby creatures. Each non-lampad creature within 120 feet who hears the lampad's weeping must succeed at a DC 36 Will save with the effects of [_crushing despair_](/Spells.aspx?ID=57).
Reciprocity Lampad queens tend to change emotions on a whim and mirror what they find in others. Those who treat the queen's domain with respect, they protect and reward, while those who harm it meet their swift wrath. This leads to the vastly differing accounts of the queens' actions.
name: Lampad Queen

Lampad queens have a particular animosity for the many predominantly evil underground ancestries, such as drow and duergar, and they are particularly fond of bats. Many lampad queens have nykteras (page 254) as favored attendants. On a failure, it is affected as if by the queen's beauty aura; if it was already affected by the aura, the conflicting emotions from the lampad queen's beauty intensify, causing the target to no longer get a flat check to end the confusion when it takes damage. Regardless of the save, the target is temporarily immune to Focus Beauty until the start of the lampad queen's next turn. Each non-lampad creature within 120 feet who hears the lampad's weeping must succeed at a DC 36 Will save with the effects of crushing despair . Those who treat the queen's domain with respect, they protect and reward, while those who harm it meet their swift wrath. This leads to the vastly differing accounts of the queens' actions.
